description:
Despite his acceptance of the Sith ways, Darth Vader is shocked to find the Empire-and himself-complicit in an evil he thought he had put behind him . . .

A Separatist freedom fighter deals with the realization that the sacrifice made by his brothers-in-arms has been for nothing-and that their families are paying the price for their resistance√ñ

The crew of a smuggler's ship is forced to take sides in a conflict they have sought to avoid--and which has already changed the course of all their lives.

The dawn of the Empire plunges the galaxy into dark times, and every direction leads to danger!
name: The Path To Nowhere, Part 2

description:
These are dark times indeed, when even the noblest of undertakings must rely on stealth, deception, and possibly the betrayal and abandonment of friends and loved ones.

Events have led Jedi Dass Jennir and his companion Bomo Greenbark to the planet Orvax‚Äîslave marketplace to the galaxy. There they face not only danger from the slavers and the Empire, but they must confront the awful truth that their goal may be beyond their reach.

Meanwhile, Darth Vader must deal with some unpleasant realities‚Äîand memories‚Äîof his own. Though he is a Dark Lord of the Sith, even he must bow before the power of the Emperor.
name: The Path To Nowhere, Part 3

description:
Overview

Boba Fett is the most feared, most respected bounty hunter in the galaxy. He only cares about two things: his money and his reputation. So when he discovers someone has been impersonating him, he decides to teach his inferior doppelganger exactly why he's the most feared, most respected bounty hunter in the galaxy! It's Boba Fett vs. Boba Fett in this 32-page one-shot -- a f√™te you won't want to miss! Twin Engines of Destruction was originally serialized in the pages of Topps' Star Wars Galaxy magazine.

volume.name: Star Wars: Boba Fett: Twin Engines of Destruction

description:
1. Cover by Curt Swan and Neal Adams.
  2. "The Battle of the Super-Pets!" Reprinted from Action Comics #277.
  3. "The Bride of Mr. Mxyzptlk!" Reprinted from Action Comics #291.
  4. "Supergirl's Farewell to Earth!" Reprinted from Action Comics #258.
  5. "The War between Supergirl and the Supermen Emergency Squad!" Reprinted from Action Comics #276.
  6. "Supergirl's Greatest Challenge!" Reprinted from Action Comics #287.

Note: An all-reprint issue. A.K.A. Giant G-57.
name: Guest-starring the Whole Superman Family!

description:
Guns blaze as Superman tries to get to the bottom of the mystery of Demolitia, a new villain who hits Metropolis with very familiar powers.

"1996 5"--Triangle in upper left hand corner.

Notes:

  • A homage to the cover of Superman #4.
name: By Darker Reason

description:
"The Trial of Superman" part 9, continued from Superman: Man of Tomorrow #3. Still on the lam from the Intergalactic Tribunal, Superman finds he's also pursued by his most hateful and relentless foe, the Cyborg. Continued in Superman: The Man of Steel (1991-2003) #52.

  1. H'Tros City!

"1996 1"--Triangle in upper left hand corner.
name: H'Tros City!

description:
"The Trial of Superman" part 4, continued from Adventures of Superman (1986-2006) #529. Chained to a gang of alien fugitives from an interstellar prison, Superman faces an entire planet of murderous monsters while an agent from the Intergalactic Tribunal closes in for the kill. Continued in Superman: The Man of Steel (1991-2003) #51.

"1995 46"--Triangle in upper right hand corner.
name: Fugitive Justice

description: 1. The Rubber Band (Superman) -- 2. Shelter For Shenanigans (Star Spangled Kid and Stripesy) -- 3. Too Hot To Handle (Zatara) -- 4. Respectable Burglars (Green Arrow) -- 5. Iss Ve Not Der Supermen? (Boy Commandos) -- 6. The Camera of Mei-Lan (Johnny Everyman) -- 7. The Men Who Died Twice (Batman & Robin)
name: Fall Issue

description:
1. Droopy
  2. Droopy
  3. Wuff the Prairie Dog
  4. Flip 'n' Dip
  5. Tom & Jerry
  6. Our Gang
  7. Barney Bear & Benny Burro
  8. Adventures of Jerry (full text)
  9. Adventures of Tom

Overview

Homicide detectives Christian Walker and Deena Pilgrim investigate murders specific to superhero cases, and they both have a secret: They both have powers.

Witness the fallout of the worst moment in POWERS history as new detectives join the homicide department.

Are Walker and Pilgrim still partners?

And who is preying on the young powers of the city?
name: The 25 Coolest Dead Super Heroes of All Time, Part  2

description: The Boys travel to Moscow, where the local supes are falling foul of a mysterious and violent enemy. An old ally awaits our heroes in the former Soviet Union- and with the brutal Russian mafia involved, they'll need all the help they can get, in part one of the four part "Glorious Five Year Plan".
name: Glorious Five Year Plan, Part One

description:
Overview

Summoned to Vatican City by the Pope himself, superhero-turned-mayor Mitchell Hundred must cross the line between church and state in a thriller that will pit him against a terrifying new group of villains.
name: Ex Cathedra Chapter Two

description:
Overview:

As the war between brothers continues, a vast new power just entered Shi'Ar space... but what have they come for? For Havok and Vulcan, the answer to that question changes everything and the fate of the Shi'Ar Empire rests on one man's shoulders.

Issue Summary:

1000 years ago, the Shi‚Äôar Scout Ship ‚ÄúBlinding Vision‚Äù‚Ä¶

Two Scout ships fly through space. In the main ship, a soldier informs his captain that they‚Äôve found something. Their sensors are picking up a massive energy reading, but they haven‚Äôt been able to make visual confirmation. And‚Ä¶ there are no stars to be found.

The captain quotes: ‚ÄúThe Gods in marriage expelled their children from the Aerie, and hid it‚Ä¶‚Äù Sharra and K‚Äôythri be praised, the captain fears. He orders the soldier to report back to Emperor Vyr‚Äôtal: the Shi‚Äôar Empire has reclaimed its birthright. The captain looks outside and sees a huge spark coming from a red planet.

The alarm goes off in the ship. The soldier warns they‚Äôre picking up life in orbit around the planet. The captain informs his Helmsman that those people are in sacred Shi‚Äôar space. He‚Äôs certain they will leave‚Ä¶ or they will die.

Feather‚Äôs Edge. Now‚Ä¶

The Shi‚Äôar ships are all under attack by the armada of the Scy‚Äôar Tal. The Starjammers are no exception. At the helm of the ship, Ch‚Äôod is warned by Havok to watch his side, but Ch‚Äôod mocks back that he‚Äôd try evasive maneuvers with his eyes closed this time, for variety. Ignoring this, Havok proclaims they need to get to the Scy‚Äôar Tal command ship, the one that fired at Vulcan. They have to try to communicate with them. Raza wants to offer the Scy‚Äôar Tal their thanks. Korvus replies that they shall see.

Alex orders Korvus to contact Lilandra and Ka‚Äôardum, and tell them to withdraw the resistance fleet now. He then asks Rachel to reach the Scy‚Äôar Tal telepathically. She tries to do so and a blue telepathic wave surrounds her body. Alex wants to see if she can figure out what the Scy‚Äôar Tal want. Ch‚Äôod reminds Alex what the name of the Scy‚Äôar Tal means, but Alex shouts at him to just drive.

Nearby, charged up magnetically, Lorna panics, her eyes growing wide. She announces to Alex that she can still feel Vulcan‚Äôs energy. He‚Äôs still alive!

Outside, Gladiator and Vulcan soar at full rage towards the Scy‚Äôar Tal ‚ÄúShard‚Äù command ship. The Scy‚Äôar Tal, on their side, continue to fire blasts on the remaining Shi‚Äôar ships. Vulcan and Gabriel fly through the walls of the command ship and instantly kill some of the crew. Gabriel demands to be brought to the Scy‚Äôar Tal leader, because‚Ä¶ he is going to kill him.

As the Scy‚Äôar Tal leader, a giant bug-like creature, enters the room, his soldiers bow for their master. The leader calls Vulcan a Shi‚Äôar pretender, and not a Shi‚Äôar. But, he does want to grant Gabriel a gift: if he runs away now, he‚Äôll live. Vulcan can‚Äôt believe his ears. They destroy his command ship, kill his men, and expect him to walk away?! He defends that he is no pretender: he is Vulcan, Emperor of the Shi‚Äôar Empire. The leader wants to know if that means Gabriel stands with the Shi‚Äôar.

To answer the question, Vulcan fires a blast from his hand at the leader, but quickly proclaims what he sees afterward as impossible‚Ä¶ the leader still lives! Vulcan continues firing, but the Scy‚Äôar Tal remains alive. Gabriel shouts at Gladiator to do something, and kill his enemy already. Gladiator does as commanded, and flies into action.

Gladiator tries to punch the leader in his face, but the Scy‚Äôar blocks it with one hand, and then he snaps Gladiator‚Äôs wrist. As Gladiator screams in pain, the leader notices aloud that Gladiator is also not a Shi‚Äôar. He throws Gladiator out of his way, and sighs at the waste. Gladiator falls through a wall and is thrown outside in space.

The leader picks Vulcan up by his throat, and swears that he will die now. And claims that it will be for nothing. His allegiance to the Shi‚Äôar has sealed his fate. Now, the Scy‚Äôar Tal will take back what is theirs. And they will have vengeance. Vulcan screams that the leader will die, and shoots blasts from his eyes. A few moments later, as the smoke clears, Vulcan is‚Ä¶ gone?

As two soldiers help their Eldest up to his feet, they inform him that the coward ran away. But, the Elder corrects, calling the man his brother, their foe is not a coward, and not weak. This one is dangerous. But, that doesn‚Äôt matter to him. All that matters is the end of the Shi‚Äôar. The end of all things.

A telepathic voice interrupts the Eldest and hopes it doesn‚Äôt come to that. When the Eldest asks who just said that, the soldier is confused, having not heard anything. The Eldest looks behind himself, to find they are no longer alone. He thinks he can see two people in his mind now, but actually, he can see an astral projection sent out by Marvel Girl. With her stands Havok. They apologize for the intrusion. The two introduce themselves, and that they‚Äôre with the Starjammers. Alex and Rachel want to talk for a moment, and add that they represent the resistance to the Shi‚Äôar Empire.

The Eldest becomes angry seeing more not-Shi‚Äôar. He realizes that Alex and Rachel are like the pretend Emperor and wonders if they will choose death as well. Havok tells the Eldest that, whatever problem he has with the Shi‚Äôar, he‚Äôs certain they can come to a peaceful solution. He sees no need for this, because the true Shi‚Äôar leader is Lilandra Neramani. She‚Äôs ready to take back control of the Empire from the man they just faced‚Ä¶ Vulcan‚Ä¶ Alex‚Äô brother.

The Eldest thinks Alex is lying, as it makes no sense what he says. He would see his own brother fail? He would fight against his own blood? Havok points out that his relationship with his brother is‚Ä¶ complicated. The Eldest agrees that nothing is more complicated that brotherhood. For, he announces, if one cannot stand with his brothers, then he will die alone. The Eldest is also aware that Rachel is in his mind, using her power. He wants her to see the truth. The Eldest moves his finger through the astral projection, towards Rachel‚Äôs eye. She screams.

Rachel is startled when a new world opens before her very eyes, and is speechless. She sees how the Shi‚Äôar attacked the red planet of the Scy‚Äôar Tal and slaughtering its people. She also sees how the Shi‚Äôar blew up the planet.

Havok and Rachel awake in their chairs at the Starjammer, with Rachel still reeling in pain from the experience. Ch‚Äôod says it‚Äôs good they‚Äôre awake again. Vulcan is counterattacking, and he thinks they‚Äôre most likely going to die now.

Outside, Vulcan‚Äôs ships fire upon other ships, belonging to the allies of the Starjammers. Rachel informs everyone that the Shi‚Äôar did this. Korvus tries to calm her down and wants her to rest. She explains she saw everything in the Eldest‚Äôs mind. The Scy‚Äôar Tal don‚Äôt have names, and simply call their leader the Eldest. The Shi‚Äôar nearly wiped out their entire civilization and drove them away from their home. Now, they want to take it back.

Raza doesn‚Äôt think this is much news, as it is what the Shi‚Äôar do. Lorna suggests that maybe they can help, and talk to Lilandra. Alex agrees with her, thinking this is not a problem. If the Scy‚Äôar Tal help them kill Vulcan, Lilandra will give them their land back. It‚Äôs a win-win. Rachel corrects Alex he doesn‚Äôt understand. Scy‚Äôar Tal isn‚Äôt their original name. They‚Äôve spent the last thousand years changing their culture, changing themselves to fight the Shi‚Äôar. Their race‚Äôs real name is M‚ÄôKraan! The planet they want, the thing they worshipped‚Ä¶ they‚Äôve come back to take back the M‚ÄôKraan Crystal. Havok considers this in silence.

Suddenly, an alarm goes off, and Raza warns the Scy‚Äôar Tal has fired a‚Ä¶ He stops talking, as something weird just happened. What was just fired has the look of a missile, but his scanners aren‚Äôt registering a weapon. The thing is headed towards a planet below them. The thing is transmitting a signal‚Ä¶ Raza realizes the Scy‚Äôar Tal have just fired a homing beacon.

Rachel thinks about something else she heard in the Eldest‚Äô name: ‚ÄúWill finally take you too.‚Äù She freaks out, and orders Raza to shoot the thing down.

Standing in a new ship, Vulcan‚Äôs pilot has also discovered that a homing beacon has just been fired. Vulcan doesn‚Äôt much care, as he wants these aliens dead and the resistance destroyed. Gladiator, holding his broken arm, sees how a blue glow surrounds all the Scy‚Äôar Tal ships‚Ä¶ they‚Äôre warping away. They‚Äôre running. Vulcan thinks about why the Scy‚Äôar Tal would first send out a homing beacon to a planet and they run away. He suddenly realizes something, and freaks out. He shouts to get out of here, now!

Aboard the Starjammer, Lorna tries to use her powers to magnetically destroy the object, but it doesn‚Äôt work. It must not be made of magnetic material. She asks Rachel what‚Äôs going on. As the object grows closer to the planet, Rachel announces that thinks she can stop the thing if she goes outside. Korvus tries to stop her, thinking she has gone mad. Rachel shouts at him to let go. She can feel the people on the planet down there, and how they fear of dying.

Suddenly, the projectile fires various blasts on the planet. Ch‚Äôod thinks he‚Äôs having a bad feeling now, just like humans tend to get. Havok shouts at Ch‚Äôod to initiate a warp jump right now.

A yellow energy ray appears, and shapes in the form of a gate, through which blinding energy flows. It is followed by an immense explosion, during which the planet explodes!

The soldiers in Vulcan‚Äôs ship are dumbstruck. When Vulcan demands to know what just happened, the captain explains they just saw Shi‚Äôar technology in action, but on a level that simply isn‚Äôt possible. A star emerged from the gate‚Ä¶ the Scy‚Äôar Tal have dropped a star on Feather‚Äôs Edge. Araki wonders who could have conceived such a weapon. While one of the soldiers puts some bandages around his arm, Gladiator wonders what the trajectory of the Scy‚Äôar Tal ships was before they left. He wonders where they were going. Araki answers they are going to the world. The Scy‚Äôar Tal are heading towards the M‚ÄôKraan Crystal. Vulcan reels at the news.

Inside the Starjammers ship, Ch‚Äôod explains that Feather‚Äôs Edge had a civilian population of 2.4 billion. They‚Äôre all dead now. Havok has opened a communications screen on which Lilandra and Ka‚Äôardum are shown. Alex asks Lilandra if the Shi‚Äôar really did what the Scy‚Äôar Tal said, and if the Crystal is their home.

Lilandra strongly denies it. She reveals that the Crystal planet is the birthplace of the Shi‚Äôar. It‚Äôs where Sharra and K‚Äôythri released the Shi‚Äôar into the universe, and then hid the Aerie into darkness. D‚ÄôKen found it, and used the scriptures and rumors of a lost Shi‚Äôar scouting expedition. Lilandra claims that the planet is the Shi‚Äôars rightful home, and that the Crystal was given to them by the gods.

In that case, Rachel wants to know, why do the Shi‚Äôar fear the Crystal? She thinks Lilandra took it from the Scy‚Äôar Tal. Raza proclaims that‚Äôs a lie. Havok takes a seat, while Raza continues his explanations. He says the Crystal is the end of all that is. That it is a nexus of all realities, but that it can destroy theirs in a blink of an eye. Even after what they just witnessed, he thinks perhaps the Scy‚Äôar Tal are the lesser of two evils. He wonders if it could be any worse than the Crystal being in Vulcan‚Äôs hands.

Suddenly, a bright light appears. Vulcan has teleported aboard the ship, along with Deathbird‚Ä¶ and the entire Imperial Guard! ‚ÄúHello, Alex,‚Äù Vulcan grins. ‚ÄúTime out.‚Äù

The most hated man in America has now become the most dangerous man in America. After going AWOL from the Thunderbolts, Robbie Baldwin hunts down the one man who can help him get what he needs as the C.S.A. and S.H.I.E.L.D. scramble to figure out exactly what the hero formerly known as Speedball is after.
name: Pt. 2

description: Iron Man has been destroyed, the Sentry's wife is murdered, nuclear missiles are being launched around the world and the one man with the plan to stop the new and improved Ultron...is a God of War who's been an Avenger a total of five minutes. With a special appearance from founding Avenger Hank Pym/Ant-Man!
name: [untitled]

description:
Overview

THE LUNA BROTHERS (ULTRA, GIRLS, SPIDER-WOMAN), return with an all-new, modern-day fantasy series: THE SWORD.

It was a day like any other for Dara Brighton, a promising young college student, until three strangers knocked on her door, looking for a unique sword, and destroyed her life.

If you like Kill Bill, Highlander, or Blade of the Immortal, you‚Äôll love THE SWORD!

1. Sacrifice for a Superman -- 2. Teen Titans #1 Preview -- 3. Metropolis Mailbag (letter column) -- 4. Curt Swan 1920-1996 (obituary)

Continued from: Superman: The Man of Steel #60

"1996 37"--Triangle in upper right hand corner.
name: The Bottle City Part 3 of 3 :  Extra!! Teen Titans 1st Issue Preview!

description: 1. Jerry & Tuffy -- 2. Tom & Jerry -- 3. Adventures Of Tom -- 4. Barney Bear -- 5. Barney Bear with Fuzzy & Wuzzy -- 6. Wuff the Prairie Dog -- 7. Droopy -- 8. Droopy -- 9. Big Spike & Little Tyke -- 10. Bertie Bird -- 11. Flip 'n' Dip -- 12. Skrewy, The Screwball Squirrel

Immediately after the events of the Ultimate Fantastic Four Crossover arc, Magneto has destroyed the portal into the Ultimate universe. He flees from the hordes of superzombies, managing to take down Hawkeye and most of Cap's head. He's alerted to the existence of some surviving humans on Asteroid M, but is killed and eaten by another group of zombies. After devouring him completely, Luke Cage sees something out of the corner of his eye... the Silver Surfer.
name: Part 1 of 5

description:
He is the one man who delivered Han Solo to both Darth Vader and Jabba the Hutt. Across the galaxy, the most-wanted criminals shudder at the mere mention of his name . . . Boba Fett!

Following the events of Dark Empire II, a Hutt's misguided affections lead to a death contract on a faraway planet. Hired by the Hutt, Boba Fett pursues an intergalactic magician who may hold the key to the Hutt's future. The fact that the magician has died only poses a slight problem for the bounty hunter, as not even the dead can escape from Boba Fett!

Boba Fett is hired by Gorga the Hutt to kill the mercenary Bar-Kooda
name: Bounty on Bar-Kooda

description:
Overview¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†

Some jobs are too much of a risk for even the best bounty hunters -- but that never stopped Boba Fett! The Imperial "Death Ship" Azgoghk , designed for the sole purpose of exterminating alien species, continues its duties long after the Empire has fallen apart. Now it's time for justice and REVENGE. When the last member of a dying species seeks to exact revenge on the Azgoghk and its crew, there's only one man he can turn to -- BOBA FETT!¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†

volume.name: Star Wars: Boba Fett: Agent of Doom

description:
Overview

From the pages of Ultimate Fantastic Four! On an Earth inhabited by zombified versions of Marvel‚Äôs greatest heroes, a ray of hope has appeared ‚Äî the space-born Silver Surfer! Still, can even a being wielding the Power Cosmic long survive among the denizens of this undead world?
name: Part 2 of 5

description:
Overview

The star rider of the spaceways - the Silver Surfer - at war with an entire world of Marvel heroes-who happen to be zombies! How do you defeat an army of the super-powered Undead, even with the Power Cosmic? There's only one way to find out. Don't miss it!
name: Part 3 of 5

description: The zombies' battle with the Silver Surfer was just a schoolyard brawl compared to the threat he heralded. Will our flesh-eating undead heroes remain undead, or will this threat from space make them even deader? No Marvel Zombie should miss it!
name: Part 4 of 5

description:
Overview

Is it wedding bells ‚Äî or an Undead extravaganza!?! The world-devouring Galactus makes his way to Earth to discover the dominant life form is ‚Äî Marvel Zombies! Can the zombies defend their world from the Big G or will they meet their end in a planet-wide conflagration? The answer will shock you in this conclusion that ties into Ultimate Fantastic Four: ‚ÄúFrightful,‚Äù beginning next month!
name: Part 5 of 5

description: Are you ready for Marvel Zombies Civil War? Forty years have passed and the zombies have come back home after eating just about everything else in the universe including living planets. Yum yum! What awaits them back on Earth, though, is beyond anything even these shambling monstrosities could have conceived! This is a new series featuring the amazing, irreverent take on the Marvel characters that became last year‚Äôs unexpected smash hit. They‚Äôre back and more stomach-churning than ever! The smash hit series is back, daring to ask: "Whose stomach are you in?"
name: [untitled]

description: A father/son fishing excursion turns into a Hemingway-esque adventure when Bart's old man battles with a marlin on the open sea. There'll be no hemming and hawing when the Simpsons weigh anchor and head out to rough waters."
name: The Bald Man and the Sea

description: Mayday's ambivalence about returning to the spider-life may prove fatal for one of her closest friends! Believing that Spider-Girl could be a volunteer at St. Andrews Shelter, a brand-new super-assassin targets all the teenage girls and sets his sights on Courtney Duran! Introducing an all-new super-villain and a guest appearance of the Hobgoblin!
name: Whatever Happened to the Daughter of Spider-Man?  Part 2: Rocked by Reverb!

description: As the Hobgoblin tries to claim the lethal legacy of Wilson Fisk, the former Kingpin of crime, Spider-Girl is chilled to the bone by the new menace called Bitter Frost.
name: Whatever Happened to the Daughter of Spider-Man?  Part 3: A Bitter Frost

description:
As Spider-Girl continues her hunt for Hobgoblin and the lethal legacy of Wilson Fisk, the former Kingpin of Crime, a vicious new player enters the fray: Mad Dog--the bounty hunter who employs the weapons of the former super-villains he's captured.

Note: This cover is a homage to Amazing Spider-Man #129
name: What Happened to the Daughter of Spider-Man?  Part 4

description:
Overview

Nine years after parting ways, the estranged members of the Umbrella Academy have gathered for the funeral of their guardian and mentor. But their reunion is far from pleasant, as old wounds reopen, murderous mimes embark on a crime spree, and one of the siblings is seduced away by a mysterious villain . . .

Conceived and written by Gerard Way of My Chemical Romance, Umbrella Academy features interior art by Eisner Award-nominated artist Gabriel B√° (De:TALES), colors by Eisner Award-winning colorist Dave Stewart, and covers by multiple Eisner Award-winning painter James Jean (Fables).
name: We Only See Each Other At Weddings And Funerals, Part Two of Six

description:
Overview

The League loses a member as writer Dwayne McDuffie turns up the heat in the "Injustice League" story arc! A party has turned very deadly for the World's Greatest Heroes when they find themselves prisoners of the Injustice League!

Superman and Black Lightning confront Lex Luthor in his powered up suit and Superman and Lex are having small talk. Lex riles up Superman by insulting him because Superman is never angry. Black Lightning then orders Lex to tell them where the rest of the Justice League is. Lex insults Black Lightning and Black Lightning sends a thunderbolt towards Lex, but it turns out to be a hologram.

Lex appears once again and Superman asks what Lex wants from him. Lex replies that it‚Äôs obvious. He wants Superman‚Äôs rage and Lex reveals his plan; that he wants Superman so angry that his powers will mean nothing in the future. Lex reveals how he plans to do that, up comes a large video feed of the Justice League being tortured. Superman is being held back by Black Lightning and video feeds of Shaggy Man being tortured gets Superman to order Lex to tell him where they are located. However, Lex stops the hologram and tells Superman to find him.

The both of them were tracking his resonance frequency and they spot the hologram projector when it explodes in Superman‚Äôs face and a small amount of kryptonite hits his face.

In the Hall of Doom, Lex questions Joker about the kryptonite paint and Joker replies that Lex did want to make Superman angry and compares it to a cavity search from loved ones. Lex stops him before too much information is revealed when Cheetah tells Lex about Grodd almost killing Geo-Force. Lex stops Grodd and he replies that it‚Äôs fun to hit him. However, Lex tells him that no one is to kill anyone until Superman is captured. Grood complies and reveals his plan of eating him after he tenderised Geo-Force‚Äôs body. Joker adds that that would something he would like to see. Lex then appreciates Grodd‚Äôs patience and adds that these videos of them being humiliated will be vital in achieving their long term goals.

Back with Superman and Black Lightning, he is washing off the kryptonite paint off Superman‚Äôs face with water and he asks what plan they have. Superman replies that he is going to take them apart and Black Lightning adds he will call in the reserves. However, Superman says that there is no time. Black Lightning buts in, telling Superman to take it easy because Lex is just making him angry on purpose. He tells Superman that Lex knows how to push his buttons and Superman replies that Black Lightning is completely objective about Lex. Black Lightning disagrees, saying that he has lost a few due to him. The both of them then agree to take on Lex by themselves. They fly towards the Hall of Doom and while Black Lightning lands his plane, Superman shoots through and goes for Parasite first, throwing up towards the sky.

Lex orders everyone to protect the prisoners and Black Lightning comes in from behind, zapping some foes. Lex claims he is just a decoy and Black Lightning strikes Lex and has him in an electric bubble. Cheetah orders Killer Frost to attack him but she refuses and Chesire steps him. Dr. Light then takes care of Superman, claiming that he‚Äôs no faster than light. All of them then pile on Superman and he is knocked unconscious.

Lex then says, ‚ÄúI‚Äôd hate for you to miss what comes next‚Ä¶‚Äù while holding a shard of kryptonite to his face.
name: Unlimited, Chapter 3: Two Against Nature

description:
Overview

Wonder Woman and Power Girl fight side-by-side against a foe who may be more powerful than both of them combined!

After battling some mummies, Power Girl picks up Wonder Woman's lasso. When Diana asks Kara where she's going next, she replies, "To murder Superman in his Fortress..."

The issue opens up with Power Girl and Wonder Woman fighting their way through mummies, and Wonder Woman says she sees a solution on how to finish this. She asks Power Girl to clear a way for her towards altar, but Power Girl doesn‚Äôt see what she means. Wonder Woman says she‚Äôs not starting an argument, but she believes that in Man‚Äôs World, brute force doesn‚Äôt accomplish anything. She unhooks her lasso and wraps it around the altar, which holds a glowing orange ball and yanks it off with her lasso. An explosion happens and all the mummies fall to dust. Wonder Woman thanks Power Girl and Power Girl is just as confused as she asks what she did to defeat them. Wonder Woman explains that she noticed mummies nearest the altar fought with greater strength, so the orb gave them a life-force.

Power Girl says that wisdom wins this time, but brute strength will work next time. She picks up Wonder Woman‚Äôs lasso and gives it to Wonder Woman. At that point, Wonder Woman asks where Power Girl is off to, and while holding the lasso, Power Girl says, ‚ÄúTo murder Superman in his fortress.‚Äù The both of them stand shocked and Power Girl is confused as to why she would say such a thing. Wonder Woman says that she was holding the lasso; that‚Äôs why she was telling the truth, but she also adds that she was surprised when she told the truth. Wonder Woman adds that Power Girl looked like she was hypnotised when she said that.

Power Girl shoots off to the sky and says she‚Äôs going to find who‚Äôs controlling her. Wonder Woman tells her to wait and wraps the lasso around Power Girl. She struggles to let go, and threatens to snap her lasso. Wonder Woman replies that it‚Äôs not just a ‚Äúrope‚Äù, it‚Äôs a magic lasso and even Kryptonians are even vulnerable to magic. Power Girl replies that she is not from this universe, so it doesn‚Äôt affect her. She tells Wonder Woman that she respects her and will give her a chance to let her go. Wonder Woman replies that since Superman is in danger, it‚Äôs everyone business and adds that they‚Äôre alike. Power Girl replies that they‚Äôre nothing alike. Wonder Woman calms her down, and asks her to remember anything during the week. Power Girl thinks and remembers Thursday, which was just her usual day in the office. On Wednesday, she remembers the same thing and on Tuesday she didn‚Äôt even leave headquarters, but on Monday, it comes up blank. Wonder Woman tells her to calm down. Power Girl then remembers a stone; a yellowish stone in her fist. Power Girl then continues on about an alchemist, a man in the shadows, and she remembers the name ‚ÄúMegistus‚Äù. Wonder Woman then thinks up the library and thinks up the worst case scenario with ‚ÄúNot that‚Ä¶‚Äù

Wonder Woman goes on to explain the Royal Library of Alexandria and that it was the storehouse of all human knowledge. It contained thousands of scrolls and carvings recording the secrets of the Ages. Megistus, who was a powerful wizard and saw the library as only loot and so he plundered the library on the texts about alchemical science. Then he burned the library. They arrive outside the library as Power Girl carries a chest full of oils and Wonder Woman with a large jar. Wonder Woman mixes a few ingredients together. Wonder Woman explains that Amazonian faith has taught them many things ‚Äì Power Girl interrupts and asks if it‚Äôs patience ‚Äì but Wonder Woman says that it has taught them that the library still exists. Power Girl says that the library is burned down, but Wonder Woman replies that she was just recounting a legend. She continues to explain that the fire was just an illusion. He really didn‚Äôt destroy it, but stole it and put it in his own dimension. A portal opens from the ingredients Wonder Woman mixed together from before. Power Girl asks if they walk in, but Wonder Woman says that they ‚Äúknock‚Äù. Together, they punch the portal and are transported to the library. Power Girl comments on the state of the library, and how much dusting it would need. Wonder Woman replies that it isn‚Äôt covered in dust, but it‚Äôs made of dust. She explains how ironic how this library is, as it holds all kinds of secrets but no one can read it, because if anyone does, this library would surely fall apart.

As Wonder Woman and Power Girl fall into their arguments again, Power Girl finds the man and shoots straight for him, almost destroying the library. Wonder Woman tells Power Girl to calm down because they don‚Äôt know what they‚Äôre up against. The strange man replies that Power Girl certainly knows who she‚Äôs up against, and introduces himself as Mr. Alchemy, heir to Megistus. He holds up the Philosopher‚Äôs Stone and explains to Power Girl that she should‚Äôve listened to Wonder Woman and exercised patience. Now, he is the one ambushing her. He then casts a spell, ‚ÄúStone to air, oxygen‚Ä¶ to cyanide.‚Äù Wonder Woman is unprepared, but Power Girl explains that she doesn‚Äôt need to breathe. ‚ÄúSome just need to cave your face in!‚Äù she continues. She gets him to drop his weapon, and he complies, too easily, and throws it to Power Girl. Wonder Woman, struggling to breathe, tells her to drop the stone, but it‚Äôs too late. Mr. Alchemy sends his spirit into the stone, through to Power Girl. Power Girl, controlled by Mr. Alchemy then begins destroying the library and Wonder Woman is shocked.

Through Power Girl, Mr. Alchemy explains that with the Stone, he absorbed everything in the library without even touching it. Now that he can destroy it through Power Girl, he is the only one that knows the knowledge contained within the library. He asks Wonder Woman, ‚ÄúComforting?‚Äù while she is buried under the debris. He continues to explain that she shouldn‚Äôt be concerned with the library of yesterday, and should be concerned with the man of tomorrow and continues to explain that it‚Äôs Superman she should be worried about, as his Fortress of Solitude is about to become a tomb of solid kryptonite. Power Girl punches Wonder Woman out, and carries Mr. Alchemy‚Äôs body out, off to kill Superman.

In the Arctic Circle, Superman comments on the great location of his Fortress of Solitude and perfect for a private meeting; he greets Power Girl. Power Girl says, ‚ÄúSo many colours to choose from. Gold, green, white‚Ä¶‚Äù and Superman is confused by this. Power Girl then says, ‚ÄúBut this is my favourite, ‚Äúand brings out the alchemical one, the one that brings change, red kryptonite. Superman transform into a strange alien form. While Mr. Alchemy continues to rant on, Power Girl fights through, with ‚ÄúKal?‚Äù, but he tells her to stay down and not to interfere. Mr. Alchemy explains that Wonder Woman is racing here to set this right. He continues to say that there‚Äôs no way she could sneak up on her, even with all her stealth and grace and says that she is no where in sight, when Wonder Woman flies through and hits Power Girl. Wonder Woman punches Power Girl, without knowing that Mr. Alchemy has gone out of Power Girl‚Äôs body and Power Girl tells her that it‚Äôs her again. Wonder Woman trusts her and she unhooks her lasso and holds the stone with her lasso. Wonder Woman tells her to take care of Superman. Wonder Woman then flies up in the sky and asks Athena to forgive for what she is about to do and throws the stone up into the sun. Wonder Woman returns and Power Girl tells her that Superman is going to be okay. She asks her Power Girl where she dropped Mr. Alchemy‚Äôs body, and Power Girl replies in London. She also asks if the body had reconnected with the stone. Wonder Woman ponders that if it did‚Ä¶ because Wonder Woman had thrown it into the sun, and so he must‚Äôve been destroyed as well.

Superman then asks humorously, how an attack, that left the Fortress of Solitude in debris, is considered a strategic attack? Wonder Woman explains that she was trying to scatter as much kryptonite as possible. Power Girl mentions that she rammed a plane into Superman‚Äôs house. Wonder Woman replies that it wasn‚Äôt the best, but it still worked. Power Girl and Wonder Woman fly off to allow Superman to rebuild his house.

Some days later, a man and a woman are reading a book and the man is reading about the incident that happened with the Philosopher‚Äôs Stone. The fact that it happened only days ago, but is seen in an ancient paper is strange. The man also comments on the second mention of ‚ÄúMegistus‚Äù and that ‚Äúfeels like the key‚Äù. The man asks another man who has just come in to investigate that and says that he will, but first, ‚ÄúPhoenix.‚Äù Another man then interrupts, and tells them that reports of an animal was seen downtown, and that all the animals there are extinct.
name: Scalpels and Chainsaws

description:
Final Night. "Sanctuary!" As Superman and Professor Hamilton return to the Fortress of Solitude to try and help the Bottle City of Kandor, but they soon run into trouble. Plus, a mysterious force is heading toward Earth's sun and the power of Superman is needed. Story continues in Final Night (1996) #1.

"1996 42"--Triangle on the right center of cover.
name: The Final Night : National Whisper : Lights Out! Did Aliens Snuff Our Sun? Artist's Conception of Sun-Eater : Where Is Superman : Lex Luthor Sighted : Recipe: Bibbo's One-Two Punch!  Whitty: My Dinner With Turtle Boy! Fish Woman Makes Media Splash!

description:
1. "Billy Dollar" story (a story which tells children to buy war stamps)
  2. "Bumbazine and Albert" (see what happens when Albert the Alligator steals Bumbazine's and Gramps Goat's catfish)
  3. Our Gang story (about a Victory Garden for wartime), all done by Walt Kelly

  2. Droopy

Overview

Death comes calling for someone close to Sara. Her subsequent capture by the FBI puts her in the hands of a few ambitious agents who clearly studied interrogation techniques at the navel base in Guantanamo.

And if she manages to survive her current ordeal, the Mafia is moving in to put her down for good.

Overview

"World on Fire" continues from writers Michael Avon Oeming and Brian Reed, artist Homs and an all-star cast of cover artists including David Mack, Dan Panosian, Homs and Joe Prado!

Sonja has returned to the lands of Hyboria and desperately attempts to assemble an army to battle Kulan Gath and his growing legions. But, will the people follow Sonja or lead her right into Gath's trap to save their own desperate lives!
name: World on Fire Part 1

description: Dynamite proudly presents "Frank Cho's Jungle Girl"! Co-Plotted and overseen by Frank Cho, scripted by Doug Murray and crafted by artist Adriano Batista and Frank Martin, the Jungle Girl is destined to be THE Dynamite series of 2007! Our first series of Jungle Girl adventures is heating up as more secrets of the island and its cast-away's are revealed! Each and every beautiful page is provided by series artist Adriano Batista (along with the beautiful colors of Frank Martin!)! Featuring two covers, one by Mr. Jungle Girl himself, Frank Cho (shipping at 75%) and the variant chase cover by Batista (shipping at 25%)! It all leads up to the ongoing series launching in '08!

Overview

Glister's hometown is competing in the national Bonny Village competition and Chilblain Hall is found wanting. Criticized for it's tumble down appearance, the Hall takes offense and goes off in a huff. Glister and her father are left without a home and the troll has nabbed the wishing well. With Chilblain Hall happily gallivanting around the world, how will they be able to persuade their errant lodging back where it belongs?
name: HOUSE HUNTING

description:
A crazed Parasite battles Superman and drains the Man of Steel of his powers. This issue leads into Superman: The Man of Steel (1991) #50, the beginning of ‚ÄúThe Trial of Superman.‚Äù

The second making of Parasite known as Parasite 2 or Rudy Jones fights Superman.
name: Doc Parasite

description:
The Joker returns to Metropolis when a sleazy manufacturer creates a toy line based upon the Clown Prince of Crime.

Notes:

  • Mighty Martian Powee Rangers are a parody of the Mighty Morphin Power Rangers.
  • Triangle 1995 #37.
  • Chronological continuation from Adventures of Superman #526.
  • Chronological continuation in Superman: The Man of Steel #49.
name: Crossing the [Punch] Line!

description:
The serial killer plaguing Metropolis gains metahuman abilities and sets out to make a corpse of the Man of Steel.

Notes:

  • Triangle 1995 #33.
  • Chronological continuation from Adventures of Superman #525.
  • Chronological continuation in Superman: The Man of Steel #48.
name: Scarlet Salvation

description: 1. Music For The Masses (Superman) -- 2. Secret of the Vulnerable Vault (Green Arrow) -- 3. The Bursting Banks (Zatara) -- 4. The Good Nazis (Boy Commandos) -- 5. Fantastic Fans (Star Spangled Kid and Stripesy) -- 6. Pilots Are Where You Find Them (Johnny Everyman) -- 7. The Mountaineers of Crime (Batman & Robin)
name: Winter Issue

description: "Kids WB!"
name: URP! I Knew I Shouldn't Have Eaten All That Cheese!

description: "Kids WB!"
name: It Came From Acme Labs! Learn Their Scheme of Terror! Witness Their Hideous Hijinks! Hear Them Say Narf! They'll Take Over the World!

description:
Throughout the vast reaches of the galaxy -- wherever fugitives meet or lawbreakers conspire -- one name is always uttered in hushed tones, a name guaranteed to strike fear into the stoutest heart: Boba Fett. His prices are exorbitant, but if you're looking for revenge, or if you're looking for protection, he'll get the job done. And if you're looking to reclaim your kidnapped fianc√©, the heiress to a Hutt's fortune, no price is too exorbitant.

Ry-Kooda seeks revenge on Gorga the Hutt for his brothers death by kidnapping Anachro, Gorga's wife. Boba is hired to rescue lady Anachro and kill Ry-Kooda
name: When the Fat Lady Swings

description:
Gorga may want to call off the hit -- the target being his father-in-law and Gorga's wife being suddenly pregnant and all -- but Boba Fett was promised a contract, and he doesn't do last-minute cancellations. It's a knockdown, drag-out roustabout in Boba Fett: Murder Most Foul!

Orko the Foultrader is dead. Boba Fett is the prime suspect - thing is, he didn't do it...
name: Murder Most Foul

description:
With the underwater city of Mer-tropolis under the control of Queen Lori and King Superman, it's up to one person to save the day and restore the city: Lex Luthor!

An early adventure of Superman from art sensation Koi Turnbull (Black Panther, Fathom) and the writing team of Jimmy Palmiotti and Justin Gray! The fate of Metropolis is at stake when Superman gets mixed up with Lori Lemaris!
name: Welcome to Mer-tropolis, Conclusion

description:
A defining moment in the history of the galaxy arrives as the Republic and the Mandalorians meet face-to-face to discuss an offer that adds up to one thing--victory for one, defeat for the other!

Sinister billionaire Lord Adasca is the organizer of this fateful rendezvous, a mastermind with grand plans for his race, the Arkanians, and his corporation, Adascorp. What Adasca hasn't counted on is the feisty Jarael, her elderly companion Camper, or their fugitive Padawan friend Zayne Carrick trying to stop these megalomaniacal machinations despite impossible odds. Of course, as soon as the three figure out how to escape Adasca's custody without getting blasted by a dozen HK-24 assassin droids, that's exactly what they're gonna do!
name: Daze Of Hate, Part 2

volume.name: Star Wars: Knights of the Old Republic

description:
Overview

The Sinestro War continues as Mogo is attacked by the Sinestro Corps. Can the largest Green Lantern of all defend itself from a squadron of Sinestro Corps members?
name: Sinestro Corps War Part 7: The Battle of Ranx

volume.name: Countdown Presents: The Search for Ray Palmer: Crime Society

description: Flycatcher doesn't have much time to enjoy his homecoming as the final battle with the Adversary looms in the near future. Can he ready his army of ghosts in time to have a chance at victory?
name: The Good Prince, Chapter Six: Envoy

description:
1. The Super-Clark of Smallville! (written by Leo Dorfman)

2. Trust Me or Kill Me! (Tales of the Legion of Super-Heroes / written by Cary Bates : reprinted in: Legion of Super-Heroes Archives #10)
name: The Super-Clark of Smallville! ; Trust Me or Kill Me!

description: Adventurer Rex Mason is a star - as the host of the reality series Treasure Quest, he travels the world on the hunt for the world's hidden riches, and it's all to help line the pockets of one of the world's richest men: Simon Stagg. When Mason's latest quest leads him to Egypt to recover the mysterious Orb of Ra, his life will be forever changed. What other surprises are in store? Find out in Metamorpho Year One!
name: Treasure Quest Part I of VI

description:
Superman fights to save Jimmy Olsen from Conduit's remaining deathtraps.

Notes:

  • Triangle 1995 #29.
  • Chronological continuation from Superman: The Man of Tomorrow #1.
  • Chronological continuation in Superman: The Man of Steel #47.
name: The Jimmy Cage!

first_appearance_locations.name: Stryker's Island Maximum Security Internment Center

location_credits.name: Stryker's Island Maximum Security Internment Center

description:
"The Death of Clark Kent" part 7. Superman defeats the villain who has destroyed the life of Clark Kent--but it may still prove to be a pyrrhic victory unless the Man of Steel can save the lives of his parents, Jimmy Olsen and Lois Lane.

Notes:

  • On page 10 panel 4 Carlin's is a homage to Mike Carlin.
  • Triangle 1995 #24.
  • Chronological continuation from Adventures of Superman #524.
  • Chronological continuation in Superman: The Man of Steel #46.
name: Home and the Hollow Heart!

description: He's been kicked, beaten, stabbed, blown up, and worst of all, turned into a puppet. Now Spike has to battle Smile Time for the fate of every child in Japan! But Smile Time has one more trick up their adorable, murderous felt-covered sleeves‚Äîpuppet versions of ALL of Spike's friends and foes!
name: Dopplegangbang

description: Captain James T. Kirk and the crew of the Enterprise discover the Strand, the multi-planet construct of a dead civilization, run by a brilliant genetic scientist who's obsessed with repopulating it. When Kirk discovers the scientist's secret, his creations revolt, forcing Kirk to make a hard decision and pushing the Enterprise into the crossfire!

Captain James T. Kirk becomes suspicious of his crew after returning from the devastated colony on Phi-11. Mr. Spock and Dr. McCoy try to reassure him that nothing's wrong‚Äîunless Kirk's two most trusted friends are in on the plot, too. What has infected the crew, and how‚Äîand who's left to help Kirk regain control of the ship?
This is where it happens: the birth of the Joker! Discover exactly what Batman's involvement was in the creation of unfettered evil!
name: Lovers & Madmen, Part Four

description:
Guy Gardner guest stars! Warrior arrives in Metropolis seeking Superman's help in dealing with super-powers that are raging out of control.

  1. Crime Tunnel: or When Warriors Strongly Disagree.

This cover is an homage to Action Comics #688

"1995 16"--Triangle in upper left hand corner.
name: Crime Tunnel or When Warriors Strongly Disagree!

description:
Mister Miracle of the New Gods guest stars when Deathtrap returns, and the villain has upped the stakes in an effort to "contain" the Man of Steel.

Notes:

  • On page 9 panel 1 Dooley Square is a homage to Kevin Dooley.
  • The cover is a homage to Mister Miracle #6.
  • Triangle 1995 #12.
  • Chronological continuation from Adventures of Superman #520.
  • Chronological continuation in Superman: The Man of Steel #42.
name: Moving Miracle!

first_appearance_locations.name: Stryker's Island Maximum Security Internment Center

location_credits.name: Stryker's Island Maximum Security Internment Center

description:
Superman battles Shadow-Dragon as the industrial spy continues to gather more deadly information about the Man of Steel.

Notes:

  • On page 1 panel 2 the street signs of Marzan Avenue and Carlin Street is a homage to Mike Carlin and Jose Marzan.
  • On page 9 panel 2 Jimmy Olsen's camera is a Mignola a homage to Mike Mignola.
  • "DC Universe 27" "Desktop Publishing"a one page photo piece featuring the desk of editor Frank Pittarese with various sketches and notes on the upcoming Showcase 95 series.
  • Triangle 1995 #8.
  • Chronological continuation from Adventures of Superman #520.
  • Chronological continuation in Superman: The Man of Steel #42.
name: Like Fire From the Dark

description:
Supergirl takes center stage as she, Clark Kent and Perry White visit Kent's hometown of Smallville.

Notes:

  • Supergirl gets top billing on the cover.
  • Superman doesn't appear in this issue only Clark Kent appears.
  • "DC Universe 26" one page text piece on the new DC Online website.
  • Triangle 1995 #4.
  • Chronological continuation from Adventures of Superman #519.
  • Chronological continuation in Superman: The Man of Steel #41.
name: Saved by the Belle!

location_credits.name: Stryker's Island Maximum Security Internment Center

description: 1. The Great Godini (Superman) -- 2. Case of the Curious Crimes (Green Arrow) -- 3. The Thieves Nobody Saw (Zatara) -- 4. Secret Weapon X-29 (Boy Commandos) -- 5. The Clown of Crime (Star Spangled Kid and Stripesy) -- 6. Dedicated to the Millions of American Negroes... (Johnny Everyman) -- 7. Crime Goes to College (Batman)
name: Spring Issue

description: This is the third issue of the level series of the Darkness
name: Level 2

description:
Overview

ALL NEW FROM REX MUNDI‚ÄôS JUAN FERREYRA!

James Lazarus suddenly finds himself on the run at the behest of his girlfriend, Dr. Emily Hoffman. Run off the road and left for dead, Lazarus rises and begins his urgent search to figure out who is responsible for attacking them and why. What he discovers is that like his namesake, Lazarus is immortal... only it's in the most painful way.

1. The Junior Reporters (Superman) -- 2. False Paradise For Felons (Star Spangled Kid and Stripesy) -- 3. The Toys That Live (Zatara) -- 4. Lord Alfred of Upson Downs (Boy Commandos) -- 5. Remote Control Robbery (Green Arrow) -- 6. The Secret of Ohain (Johnny Everyman) -- 7. Specialists in Crime (Batman)
name: Summer Issue

description:
"From the Heart!" Guest-starring Wonder Woman. In the aftermath of the Sun-Eaters attack (see Final Night (1996) #1-4), Superman remains powerless. As S.T.A.R. Labs tries to find a way to return his powers, Clark gets some much needed relationship advise from his close friend, Wonder Woman. Meanwhile, the woman in question, Lois Lane continues her adventures abroad.

"1996 46"--Triangle in upper left hand corner.
name: From The Heart

description:
Overview

With the triple-threat danger of The Syndicate, The Government, and The Order, life is closing in faster than planned for Michael Iron. Big Daddy and his Syndicate crew make a fatal discovery about the strength of Iron‚Äôs survival instincts, while Angel comes to realize her own startling instincts. Meanwhile, Detective Manetti won‚Äôt let up his investigation into Iron‚Äôs exploits, and his search for clues leads him to an interesting ‚Äúcommunion‚Äù of sorts between Iron and The Order?
name: Stop the Press

description:
Overview

Astrid and Dave are teenagers stuck in a dead-end suburban town living uneventful lives ‚Äì until Astrid gets a visit from her childhood imaginary friends, who tell her something big is about to happen. Are they real or is she crazy? Life is about to get a lot more interesting for the pair ‚Äì interesting and very, very dangerous. From the co-creator of PHONOGRAM comes this tale of magic, mystery and underage drinking.

Overview

A young woman is kidnapped‚Äîbound, gagged and fearing for her life. Her captor is a deranged man named Moses, looking to satisfy his burning desire to kill. Can she outsmart this maniac before he succeeds? Do not miss the most intense RIDE story yet!

Strikingly illustrated by TOMM COKER (Moon Knight, Blood & Water), the co-writer/director of the upcoming Lionsgate horror film Catacombs, illustrates the first-ever RIDE horror tale: THE KEY TO SURVIVAL!

volume.name: The Ride Halloween Special: The Key to Survival

"A giant comic," i.e. A Dell Giant
name: M.G.M.'s Tom and Jerry Picnic Time

description:
Featuring guest-art by Steve Leiber (Whiteout). The aftermath of "Our Worlds at War" has taken its toll on the Man of Steel. Superman returns to Smallville in order to restore the Kent farm, but he can't shake the terrible feelings inside him. Will Superman hang up his costume for good?

  1. Every Blade of Grass.

"2001 42"--black Superman "S" in upper right hand corner.
name: Every Blade of Grass

description:
Overview


World War III," Part 4. After this issue there's no turning back! Amidst the chaos of a world going mad: Duke's personal life is invaded by a Cobra operative, the G.I. Joe traitor, Blackout, makes a decision that sets the world aflame, and the mysterious Agent Delta makes his move... but which side is he on?
name: World War III, Part 4: Manufacturing Consent

description: The title says it all! For months now readers have witnessed the unimaginable and unthinkable as New Gods across the DCU have seemingly died, with Lightray's death in COUNTDOWN the biggest of them all. Now, the carnage continues but the mystery and adventure is just beginning! Jim Starlin ‚Äî master of the cosmic odyssey ‚Äî writes and illustrates this epic tale of death and destruction on a scale never seen before. With a cast of hundreds and cameos by the entire DCU, this intergalactic 8-part series cannot be missed!
name: So Begins... The End

description: When it comes to capturing the Hulk, General Ross doesn‚Äôt fool around. He‚Äôs recruited the nuclear powered villain Radioactive Man and he‚Äôs also outfitted Madrox the Multiple Man with a Hulkbuster exoskeleton that duplicates when he does. But the Hulk‚Äôs not the only one in trouble when their mountainside battle triggers an avalanche that threatens an entire town.
name: The Hills Are Alive With The Sound Of Mayhem

description: Marvel Adventures presents a new series of amazing stories of everyone's favorite web-slinger. In addition to the action-packed modern adaptations of the Spider-Man classics, Marvel Adventures will bring you new untold stories featuring the greatest heroes and villains of the Marvel Universe. And we're kicking it off with a new version of the greatest tale ever told - The Birth of Spider-Man! Acclaimed children's book author Kitty Fross joins the House of Ideas with her take on the famed origin of the hero known as...SPIDER-MAN!
name: Here Comes Spider-Man

description: While Spider-Girl deals with the guilt over what happened to her baby brother, the Hobgoblin narrates this issue as he cements his plans for a gang war with the Black Tarantula.
name: I, Hobgoblin!

description: A doctor is becoming famous for his seeming ability to cure patients of terrible diseases. Nobody‚Äôs sure how he does it, but everyone is fascinated by what seems to be a "healing touch." When the mysterious doc crosses paths with the scientific mind of Reed Richards, the FF are in for some surprises they never bargained for--and the adventures are just beginning!
name: The Diabolical Dr. Santos

description: 1. Merton Gloop and his Magic Horseshoe (Superman) -- 2. Captain Tootsie -- 3. Outlaw World (Tommy Tomorrow) -- 4. Mystery of the Stolen Bell (Congo Bill) -- 5. The Cowboy Magician (Vigilante)
name: Another Daring Adventure With the World's Champion Hero- Superman : Thrills of the 21st Century with Tommy Tomorrow

description:
1. Cover by Nick Cardy.
  2. "At Last! Clark Kent--Super-Hero!" written by Elliot S. Maggin, penciled by Curt Swan and inked by Tex Blaisdell.
  3. "7 Threats in the 7 Seas!" 2 pages of reprinted adventures of the Sea Devils from Sea Devils issues 2, 3, 6, 7, 8, 9 & 12.
  4. "The Ghost of the Deep!" Reprinted from Sea Devils #3.
  5. "The Quiet Man" (gag strip)
  6. "Super-Puzzle" (a puzzle activity) by Bob Rozakis.
  7. "Revolt in Painted Canyon!" Reprinted from Western Comics #78.
  8. "What's the Difference Between..." 1/3 page (factoid) comparing the difference between a Mesa and a Butte.
  9. "The Super-Brain of Adam Strange!" Reprinted from Mystery in Space #87.
  10. "Amazing Thefts of the I.Q. Gang!" Reprinted from Mystery in Space #87.
  11. "Bird-Wings" 1/3 page (shows three different kinds of bird wings).
  12. "The Man in the Iron Mask" Reprinted from Sensation Comics #4.
name: At Last! Clark Kent--Super-Hero!
